title: Ticket #1403: Eliminate file transfer services started by Condor for grid universe
description:
Condor starts up file transfers services under the gridmanager to perform file staging for several types of grid universe jobs: a GASS server for gt2, and a gridftp server for gt4 and cream. A remote user with a copy of the job owner's proxy can connect to these servers to read or write any file of the job owner, not just files related to their jobs. These servers also require a range of ports be opened for incoming connections, which some site admins may be reluctant to configure in their firewalls.

For these reasons, we want to eliminate these file transfer services and have Condor act in a purely client mode for these job types.

Milestones

  • Build proof-of-concept file transfer code for Cream jobs [DONE]
  • Write gridftp file transfer management code for gridmanager [DONE]
  • Use active file transfers for Cream jobs [DONE]
  • Use active file transfers for GRAM4 jobs [WON'T DO]
  • Use active file transfers for GRAM2/5 jobs
  • Add rate-limiting [DONE]
  • Improve connection caching in nordugrid_gahp [DONE]

Cream Jobs

A Cream client can submit a job with a mixture of client- and server-initiated file transfers. Here is an example job description snippet: 

InputSandbox = { "gsiftp://remote.edu/foo/in" };
OutputSandbox = {
    "out1",
    "out2"
    };
OutputSandboxDestURI = {
    "gsiftp://localhost/out1",
    "gsiftp://remote.edu/foo/out2"
    };

When the job is first submitted, the client is given gridftp URLs for an Input Sandbox (ISB) and an Output Sandbox (OSB). These are directories used to hold input and output files transferred by the client. In this example, the server will transfer the files in and out2 between itself and remote.edu. In addition, the client can transfer additional input files to the ISB before signaling that the job should be started (i.e. submitted to the batch system behind the Cream server). Once the job completes, out1 will be available in the OSB for the client to retrieve. If the client wants to retrieve all output files itself, it can use wildcards to say that all output files should be saved. This removes the need to name all output files using transfer_output_files in the Condor submit file.

2010-Jun-11 09:45:02 by jfrey:
In Condor 7.5.3, file transfers for cream jobs are initiated by the gridmanager using the nordugrid gahp. The nordugrid gahp now executes multiple commands to each server in parallel, with a rate limit of 10 active transfers. Idle connections are held for 30 seconds waiting for new transfer commands from the gridmanager. There's no global limit on active transfers yet.
